page.title: 08Cheshunt 40 years ago
page.content: Families were about the same size as today.Some mothers had local jobs . Houses had bathrooms inside toilets and were heated by coal fires.Cooking was by gas ovens, and doing the family washing was still a major task. There were few household gadgets. Families went to church on Sundays. Discipline at school was strict. School started at 5 years, and ended at 14. Marks were given for conduct, and the cane was used. School dinners were horrible. Food was cheaper, and most was loose or in tins.Stockings,fresh fruit,sweets, and cigarettes and many other items were difficult to get in the 2nd world war.Food was rationed.Shops were small and personal.Public transport was cheap. Buses came through Cheshunt, and steam trains went to London. There were few cars,and roads were bumpy.Milk floats were horse-drawn.
